wrote: {{Quotation|This businessman with a murky past had used his fortune to exhibit at The Louvre. ... The crew [of the ''Sewol''] was mainly made up of followers of the church of Yoo; temporary, often renewed and who were unfamiliar with their ship. The investigation also revealed that the owner had only spent 541,000 won ($521; €400) on crew training, including evacuation drills for its employees in 2013. Its wealthy owner had other priorities ... he used his fortune to organize worldwide exhibitions of his landscape photographs.|Frédéric Ojardias|Corée, le scandaleux propriétaire du ferry naufragé|La Croix{{cite news |last=Ojardias |first=Frédéric |url=http://www.la-croix.com/Actualite/Monde/Coree-le-scandaleux-proprietaire-du-ferry-naufrage-2014-04-27-1141958 |title=Corée, le scandaleux propriétaire du ferry naufragé |trans-title=Korea, the outrageous owner of the wrecked ferry |work=[[La Croix]] |language=French |date=27 April 2014 |accessdate=1 June 2014}}{{cite news |last1=Nam |first1=In-soo |last2=Lee |first2=Min-jeong |last3=Kwaak |first3=Jeyup S. |url=https://online.wsj.com/news/articles/SB10001424052702304518704579518993969767898 |title=South Korea Ferry Probe: Cargo Was Three Times Recommended Maximum |work=[[The Wall Street Journal]] |date=23 April 2014 |accessdate=1 June 2014 |quote=Chonghaejin's audit report for last year showed the company spent 541,000 won ($521) on crew training, including evacuation drills, as it ran a 2013 operating loss of 785 million won. In comparison, Daea Express Shipping Co., which runs four ferries on the one-hour Incheon-Deokjuk island route, spent 11.14 million won on crew training last year. |subscription=yes}}}} [[France Info]] commented: {{Quotation|In the Tuileries as at Versailles Ahae himself had financed his own exhibitions. ... In 2013, the company spent $500 in costs for training their crews, an amount that pales in comparison to the wealth of the owner of the shipping company. However, one of the main causes of the tragedy was precisely the total lack of preparation of the crew in case of disaster.|Pierrick de Morel|Corée du Sud : qui est Yoo Byung-Eun, propriétaire du ferry naufragé ?|France Info{{cite news |last=de Morel |first=Pierrick |url=http://www.franceinfo.fr/article/coree-du-sud-qui-est-yoo-byung-eun-proprietaire-du-ferry-naufrage-456583 |title=Corée du Sud : qui est Yoo Byung-Eun, propriétaire du ferry naufragé? |trans-title=South Korea: who is Yoo Byung-Eun, owner of the wrecked ferry? |language=French |publisher=Franceinfo.fr |date=24 April 2014 |accessdate=1 June 2014}}}} ;Gallery File:AHAE- Grande salle principle.jpg|Tuileries Garden 2012 File:AHAE - La salle des nuages.jpg|Tuileries Garden 2012 File:AHAE - La salle des nuages, détail.jpg|Tuileries Garden 2012 File:AHAE ... again.jpg|Tuileries Garden 2012 File:AHAE ... again 2.jpg|Tuileries Garden 2012 File:Expo AHAE Versailles 12.jpg|Versailles 2013 File:Expo AHAE Versailles 05.jpg|Versailles 2013 File:Expo AHAE Versailles 14.jpg|Versailles 2013 File:Expo AHAE Versailles 20.jpg|Versailles 2013 File:Expo AHAE Versailles 04.jpg|Versailles 2013 File:Expo AHAE Versailles 17.jpg|Versailles 2013 File:Expo AHAE Versailles 07.jpg|Versailles 2013 File:Expo AHAE Versailles 10.jpg|Versailles 2013 == The sinking of the ''Sewol'' == {{main|Sinking of the MV Sewol}} The ferry ''Sewol'' capsized and sank on 16 April 2014. It was carrying 476 people, mostly secondary school students from [[Danwon High School]] who were travelling from [[Incheon]] towards [[Jeju City|Jeju]].{{cite news |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2014/04/16/korea-ship-missing-idUSL3N0N81P420140416 |title=More than 300 people missing after South Korea ferry sinks – coast guard |agency=Reuters |last=Park |first=Ju-min |date=16 April 2014}} The sinking resulted in 304 deaths, and is the worst [[List of South Korean ferry disasters|ferry disaster in South Korea]] since 14 December 1970, when the sinking of the ferry ''Namyoung'' cost 326 people out of 338 their lives.{{cite news |last=Withnall |first=Adam |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/asia/south-korea-ferry-disaster-civilian-divers-scouring-the-sewol-wreckage-are-being-paid-by-the-body-presidential-office-suggests-9435932.html |title=South Korea ferry disaster: Civilian divers scouring the Sewol wreckage are being ‘paid by the body’, presidential office suggests |work=The Independent |date=26 May 2014 |accessdate=28 May 2014}}{{cite web|last=Hong |first=Gil-dong |url=http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20140418001041 |title=Major disasters in Korea |work=[[The Korea Herald]] |date=18 April 2014 |accessdate=31 May 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140612120338/http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20140418001041 |archivedate=12 June 2014 |df= }}{{cite news|title=Over 280 missing after South Korean ferry capsizes |date=16 April 2014 |agency=Reuters |url=http://in.reuters.com/article/2014/04/16/us-korea-ship-idINKBN0D205U20140416 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140605125600/http://in.reuters.com/article/2014/04/16/us-korea-ship-idINKBN0D205U20140416 |archivedate= 5 June 2014 |df= }} ''Sewol'' was operated by the company [[Chonghaejin Marine]]. === Ownership === Before his death, Yoo had widely been described as "the owner of" or "the ''de facto'' owner of" the sunken ferry ''Sewol'', and was former chairman of Chonghaejin Marine. Son Byong-ki, Yoo's lawyer, stated on 25 April that Yoo "has no financial ties to Chonghaejin or its subsidiaries."{{cite news |url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2014/04/25/2014042501240.html |title=Ferry Operator's Owner Ready to Give Away Fortune |work=[[The Chosun Ilbo]] |date=25 April 2014 |accessdate=28 May 2014}} A press release from Yoo's U.S. [[publicist]], Ahae Press Inc., stated that "[Mr. Yoo] does not own any shares, direct or indirect, of Chonghaejin." Financial filings confirmed that Yoo had no stake in the shipping company. Yoo was the head of the family who partially own Chonghaejin Marine, and is believed to have exercised influence through a web of company [[Cross ownership|cross-shareholdings]].{{cite news |last=Kim |first=Narae |title=Boy who raised alarm on doomed Korean ferry had no time to call parents |url=http://www.standard-freeholder.com/2014/04/26/boy-who-raised-alarm-on-doomed-korean-ferry-had-no-time-to-call-parents |accessdate=19 May 2014 |work=[[Cornwall Standard Freeholder]] |date=26 April 2014}} His two sons, Yoo Dae-kyun ({{Lang|ko|유대균}}; born {{circa|1970}}), and second son Yoo Hyuk-kee, are controlling the shipping firm through a majority [[Equity (finance)|stake]] in the [[investment vehicle]] I-One-I Holdings as well as 13 unlisted [[Subsidiary|affiliates]] which through a tangled web of ownership structure own each other, a structure prosecutors describe as pyramid-like, and ultimately is controlled by individuals― Yoo's two sons and seven of his friends.{{cite news |last=Kim |first=Da-ye |url=https://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/nation/2014/04/116_156406.html |title=Who controls Semo Group? |work=The Korea Times |date=30 April 2014 |accessdate=29 May 2014}}{{cite news|last=Park |first=Eun-jee |url=http://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/article/Article.aspx?aid=2989634 |title=Prosecutors warn anyone who helps Yoo escape |work=[[Korea JoongAng Daily]] |date=24 May 2014 |accessdate=27 May 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140528005740/http://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/article/article.aspx?aid=2989634 |archivedate=28 May 2014 |df= }} Chung Sun-seop, editor of Chaebul.com, a website that analyses South Korea's [[chaebol]] business groups, said that "This kind of shadow management through his children or close aides is not uncommon among chaebol companies."{{cite news |last=Mundy |first=Simon |title=South Korean sect ends stand-off over Sewol ferry disaster |url=http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/6e1e194c-e0c0-11e3-a934-00144feabdc0.html |work=[[Financial Times]] |date=21 May 2014 |accessdate=29 May 2014 |subscription=yes}} On 23 April investigators of the [[Incheon]] District Prosecutors' Office raided the head office of Chonghaejin Marine, and some 20 offices of its affiliates, as well as the office of the Evangelical Baptist Church in [[Yongsan]], central Seoul. Prosecutors suspected that funds from members of the religious group had been used in business operations of Chonghaejin Marine and Yoo Byung-eun.{{cite news|url=http://english.yonhapnews.co.kr/news/2014/04/23/0200000000AEN20140423003400315.html |title=Prosecution raided sunken ferry operator, affiliates |agency=[[Yonhap]] |date=23 April 2014 |accessdate=23 June 2014}} The prosecution found more than 100 bogus companies, many of them set up and operated by followers of a Yoo's religious group, had paid Yoo and his two sons at least {{SK won|100|link=no}} billion (~{{US$|97.1}} million) for their "consulting services," and had purchased photos taken by Yoo.{{cite news|last=Na |first=Jeong-ju |url=https://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/biz/2014/05/488_156641.html |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140623071153/https://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/biz/2014/05/488_156641.html |deadurl=no |archivedate=23 June 2014 |title='Yoo used 100 'bogus' firms for embezzlement' |work=[[The Korea Times]] |date=6 May 2014 |accessdate=9 June 2014}} Yoo's religious group denied cross-border transactions with affiliates of the ferry operator.{{cite news|last=Kang |first=Seung-woo |url=https://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/nation/2014/04/116_156252.html |title=Salvation sect stages protest rally |work=[[The Korea Times]] |date=28 April 2014 |accessdate=23 June 2014}} The Prosecution secured video footage of a lecture Yoo delivered to the sect's believers in April 2010, in which Yoo admitted to have registered properties under the names of other persons.{{cite news | url=http://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/article/article.aspx?aid=2991271 | title=Sewol suspects' assets to be seized | work=[[Korea JoongAng Daily]] | date=28 June 2014 | agency=Yonhap | accessdate=2 July 2014}} A lawyer representing Yoo Dae-kyun and Yoo Hyuk-kee said on 22 April that "If there is any legal responsibility, the owners are willing to offer their wealth and assets to help compensate the victims." On 24 April the two sons apologised in a written statement saying: "We will humbly accept all responsibility for this accident and we will not hesitate to do anything to console the pain of victims and grieving families even a little bit." === Leadership === Michael Ham, managing director of Ahae Press and co-director of Evangelical Media Group, in a press release 25 April 2014 said: "Mr. Yoo does not have any involvement in the management or day-to-day operations of Chonghaejin Marine Co. ... I know that he has been spending every single day of the past four to five years focusing on his photography work."{{cite news |last=Kim |first=Da-ye |url=https://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/nation/2014/04/116_156333.html |title=Yoo tries to protect reputation as photographer |work=The Korea Times |date=29 April 2014 |accessdate=5 June 2014}} Yoo's lawyer said that Yoo has been not been involved in corporate management since Semo went bankrupt in 1997. Investigators have obtained evidence indicating Yoo as the ''de facto'' leader of the company. One piece of evidence is a detailed list of all the company's staff prepared on 15 April 2014, a day before the sinking of the MV ''Sewol'', which named Yoo as chairman of Chonghaejin Marine with employee number A99001, or employee No. 1 at the company, which was established in 1999.{{cite news |url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2014/05/09/2014050901411.html |title=Investigators Confirm Ownership of Ferry Operator |work=[[The Chosun Ilbo]] |date=9 May 2014 |accessdate=9 May 2014}} They also discovered a pay stub that records a payment of {{SK won|15|link=no}} million (~{{US$|14,700}}) monthly over more than a year.{{cite news |last=Kim |first=Da-ye |url=https://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/nation/2014/05/116_156891.html |title=Yoo may face homicide charges |work=The Korea Times |date=12 May 2014 |accessdate=27 May 2014}}{{cite news |last=Jeong |first=Hyo-sik |title=Yoo directed Sewol remodeling, testimony says |work=[[Korea JoongAng Daily]] |url=http://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/article/article.aspx?aid=2989414 |accessdate=21 May 2014 |date=20 May 2014}} They have also obtained testimony from others that Yoo was directly involved in managing the ferry operator. ''Sewol'' was remodeled between October 2012 and February 2013 to increase the number of passenger [[Cabin (ship)|cabin]]s and add a fifth floor, mainly used as an [[exhibition hall]] for photographs by Yoo (Ahae). The employee of Chonghaejin who was in charge of the [[refit]]ting testified that he carried out the expansion under the direction of Yoo. Investigators found that Yoo has glossed over critical problems with the stability of the refurbished vessel. According to the prosecution, the regular captain of the ''Sewol'' testified that he had warned Chonghaejin Marine of serious stability problems with the vessel,{{cite news |url=http://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/asiapacific/captain-says-warnings/1090142.html |title=Captain says warnings over Korean ferry ignored |publisher=Channel NewsAsia |date=30 April 2014 |accessdate=31 May 2014}} and Kim Han-shik, the chief of Chonghaejin Marine notified Yoo of the risks of overloading it with freight in January 2014. Kim reportedly pointed out the ferry's weakened ability to recover left-and-right balance when tilted due to the extension in the number of cabins, and advised Yoo to sell off the ferry.{{cite news |author= |url=http://world.kbs.co.kr/english/news/news_Dm_detail.htm?lang=e&id=Dm&No=102817 |title=Hidden Ferry Owner Aware of Structural Issues of Ill-fated Ship |publisher=[[Korean Broadcasting System]] |date=26 May 2014 |accessdate=28 May 2014}} Yoo allegedly told them to keep running ''Sewol'' as usual and put up for sale both the sister ship ''Ohamana'' and ''Sewol'' in March.{{cite news |url=http://english.yonhapnews.co.kr/full/2014/05/07/71/1200000000AEN20140507006700315F.html |title=Sewol operator logged most accidents over 5 years |agency=[[Yonhap]] |date=7 May 2014 |accessdate=31 May 2014}}{{cite news |last=Kim |first=Cynthia |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2014-05-08/s-korean-prosecutors-arrest-ferry-operator-ceo-kim-over-sinking.html |title=South Korean Ferry Operator CEO Is Arrested Over Sinking |publisher=Bloomberg |date=8 May 2014 |accessdate=31 May 2014}}{{cite web |last=Chan |first=Crystal |url=http://www.ihsmaritime360.com/article/12551/chonghaejin-selling-sewol-s-sister-ferry |title=Chonghaejin selling Sewol's 'sister ferry' |publisher=IHS Maritime 360 |date=2 May 2014 |accessdate=28 May 2014}} On 20 May it was confirmed that the overloading and remodeling of the ship compromised its ability to maintain stability during the time of the accident. === Allegations and charges === Based on the [[Direct evidence|evidence]], prosecutors concluded that Yoo was the one who directs operation and execution of business, and planned to hold Yoo [[vicariously liable]] for the acts of the operator's crew members. Accordingly, the prosecution was poised to cite "[[negligent homicide]]" in its coming application of criminal law against Yoo.{{cite news|last=Kim |first=Yon-se |url=http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20140526001619 |title=Yoo ignored ferry's problems: prosecution |work=[[The Korea Herald]] |date=28 May 2014 |accessdate=26 May 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140622103946/http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20140526001619 |archivedate=22 June 2014 |df= }}{{cite web|url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2014/05/27/2014052700707.html |title=Ferry Owner Deeply Involved in Operations |work=[[The Chosun Ilbo]] |date=27 May 2014 |accessdate=27 May 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140527214826/http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2014/05/27/2014052700707.html |archivedate=27 May 2014 |df= }} Yoo was [[Criminal charge|charged]] with [[embezzlement]], breach of [[Position of trust|trust]] and [[tax evasion]].{{cite news|url=https://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/nation/2014/05/116_157690.html|title=Arrest warrant issued for Yoo|last=Lee|first=Hyo-sik|date=22 May 2014|work=[[The Korea Times]]|accessdate=22 May 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140522160557/https://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/nation/2014/05/116_157690.html|archivedate=March 2014|deadurl=no}} He is suspected of embezzling {{SK won|128.9|link=no}} billion (~{{US$|125.8}} million) from his companies, including {{SK won|44.6|link=no}} billion (~{{US$|43.5}} million) transferred overseas illegally, as part of a scheme to sell his nature photographs to his companies for tens of millions of won. He also owes an estimated {{SK won|10.1|link=no}} billion (~{{US$|9.8}} million) in taxes for the photos sold.{{cite news |url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2014/05/23/2014052301339.html |title=Ferry Owner Put on Most-Wanted List |work=[[The Chosun Ilbo]] |date=23 May 2014 |accessdate=23 May 2014}} Prosecutors also found evidence that Yoo's family set up several paper companies with no consultants, which then collected some {{SK won|20|link=no}} billion (~{{US$|19}} million) in consulting fees from companies related to Semo Group over the last few years.{{cite news |last=Kim |first=Da-ye |url=https://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/nation/2014/04/116_156269.html |title=Sewol owner's paper companies raided |work=The Korea Times |date=28 April 2014 |accessdate=28 April 2014}}{{cite news |last=Hong |first=Gil-dong |url=http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20140502001216 |title=Prosecution issues ultimatum to ferry owner family, aides |work=[[The Korea Herald]] |date=2 May 2014 |accessdate=30 May 2014}} They are also looking into [[circumstantial evidence]] that Yoo's family has claimed commission fees of tens of billions of won from the related companies for the use of [[trademark]] rights for names like ''Sewol.''{{cite news |url=http://english.kbs.co.kr/news/news_view.html?No=102263&id=Po |title=Head of Sunken Ferry Operator Appears for Probe as Suspect |publisher=english.kbs.co.kr |date=29 April 2014 |accessdate=29 April 2014}} On 30 June, the Prosecution announced its intention to indict Yoo, irrespective of whether or not he was apprehended, citing "homicide by negligence" in the charges.{{cite news |url=http://nwww.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20140630001089 | title=Prosecution seeks to indict fugitive Sewol owner | work=The Korea Herald | date=30 June 2014 | accessdate=2 July 2014}} === Investigation === Yoo made no known public appearances since the ''Sewol'' sank.{{cite news |last=Borowiec |first=Steven |url=http://www.latimes.com/world/asia/la-fg-south-korea-ferry-church-raid-20140521-story.html |title=Church compound raided in probe of South Korean ferry tragedy |work=[[Los Angeles Times]] |date=21 May 2014 |accessdate=30 May 2014}}{{cite news |url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2014/05/14/2014051401961.html |title=Cowardly Ferry Owner Must Face the Law |work=[[The Chosun Ilbo]] |date=14 May 2014 |accessdate=30 May 2014}} The [[Ministry of Justice (South Korea)|Ministry of Justice]] banned within the first week of the investigation Yoo, his eldest son Yoo Dae-kyun, and more than 60 other employees in various companies owned by Yoo or his sons from leaving South Korea. Son Byeong-gi, a lawyer representing both Yoo, Chonghaejin Marine, and I-One-I Holdings, said on 22 April that "If there is any legal responsibility, the owners are willing to offer their wealth and assets to help compensate the victims." The [[Park Geun-hye]] administration pledged to exercise the right to [[indemnity]] against Yoo and Chonghaejin Marine as soon as the state compensates victims' families. The combined [[damages]] from the sinking of the ''Sewol'' are estimated to reach {{SK won|2|link=no}} trillion (~{{US$|1.9}} billion).{{cite news |url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2014/05/20/2014052000872.html |title=W20 Billion of Ferry Owner's Properties Seized |work=[[The Chosun Ilbo]] |date=20 May 2014 |accessdate=9 June 2014}}{{cite news |url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2014/05/22/2014052201875.html |title=Why Seizing Ferry Owner's Assets Is Vital |work=[[The Chosun Ilbo]] |date=22 May 2014 |accessdate=9 June 2014}} The accumulated value of the assets owned by Yoo and his family is estimated at over {{SK won|240|link=no}} billion (~{{US$|235}} million).{{cite news |url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2014/04/23/2014042301119.html |title=Prosecutors Investigate Foul Play at Ferry Operator |work=[[The Chosun Ilbo]] |date=23 April 2014 |accessdate=30 May 2014}}{{cite news |url=https://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/nation/2014/04/116_156269.html |title=Sewol owner's paper companies raided |work=The Korea Times |date=28 April 2014 |accessdate=30 May 2014}} It includes an estimated {{SK won|129.1|link=no}} billion (~{{US$|126.7}} million) held by Yoo himself, {{SK won|49.2|link=no}} billion (~{{US$|48.3}} million) by eldest daughter Yoo Som-na, {{SK won|5.6|link=no}} billion (~{{US$|5.5}} million) by eldest son Yoo Dae-kyun, and {{SK won|55.9|link=no}} billion (~{{US$|54.9}} million) by the second son Yoo Hyuk-kee.{{cite news |last=Hong |first=Gil-dong |url=http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20140528001641 |title=FSS seeks to freeze Sewol cash flows |work=[[The Korea Herald]] |date=24 April 2014 |accessdate=30 May 2014}} Son Byeong-gi representing Yoo told the ''[[Chosun Ilbo]]'' on 24 April that reports that Yoo's assets total {{SK won|240|link=no}} billion were not true, but that Yoo had "voiced his willingness to donate his entire {{SK won|10|link=no}} billion (~{{US$|9.8}} million) estate due to his deep sorrow for those who lost their lives aboard the ''Sewol''." A prosecution official investigating Yoo's holdings said there was a "huge gap" between what the former chairman claimed he was worth and what investigators had found out so far. Son claimed on 25 April that he had been misunderstood and by {{SK won|10|link=no}} billion had meant "tens of billions" of won, and that Yoo was willing to donate his "entire" assets, whatever their size.{{cite news |url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2014/04/28/2014042801419.html |title=Mystery Surrounds Dubious Owner of Ferry Operator |work=[[The Chosun Ilbo]] |date=28 April 2014 |accessdate=30 May 2014}} Son later resigned as lawyer for the family on 15 May.{{cite news |last=Park |first=Min-woo |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2014/05/16/us-southkoreaferry-idUSBREA4F06L20140516 |title=Another arrest sought in hunt for South Korean ferry operator owner |agency=Reuters |date=16 May 2014 |accessdate=30 May 2014}} A [[financier]] of the Evangelical Baptist Church of Korea was summoned for questioning on 24 April to trace deals between the sect and companies run by Yoo and his two sons.{{cite news|url=http://www.koreapost.com/news/view.html?section=158&category=167&no=553 |title=Sewol Owner Yoo rudely uses ambassadors to show off his 'popularity' |work=Korea Post |publisher=Koreapost.com |date=28 May 2014 |accessdate=30 May 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140531142756/http://www.koreapost.com/news/view.html?section=158&category=167&no=553 |archivedate=31 May 2014 |df= }} Transcripts of land registers showed that four days later Yoo and his family signed over some 24 properties worth around {{SK won|27|link=no}} billion (~{{US$|26}} million) to the Evangelical Baptist Church of Korea on 28 and 29 April.{{cite news|url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2014/05/22/2014052201900.html |title=Ferry Owner Signed Property Over to Cult |work=[[The Chosun Ilbo]] |date=22 May 2014 |accessdate=30 May 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140524045618/http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2014/05/22/2014052201900.html |archivedate=24 May 2014 |df= }} On 13 May, the Incheon District Prosecutors' Office summoned Yoo to appear for questioning by 16 May,{{cite news |url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2014/05/14/2014051400841.html |title=Ferry Owner Summoned for Questioning |work=[[The Chosun Ilbo]] |date=14 May 2014 |accessdate=30 May 2014}} but he failed to heed the call,{{cite news |last=Kim |first=Da-ye |url=https://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/nation/2014/05/116_157216.html |title=Cult followers in standoff with prosecution |work=The Korea Times |date=14 May 2014 |accessdate=30 May 2014}} and was presumed hiding in the church compound Geumsuwon south of Seoul.{{cite news |url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2014/05/15/2014051500759.html |title=Ferry Owner's Son on Most-Wanted List |work=[[The Chosun Ilbo]] |date=15 May 2014 |accessdate=30 May 2014}} All of Yoo's children and a number of key suspects had ignored the summons.{{cite news |last=Hong |first=Gil-dong |url=http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20140514001293 |title=Cult linked to ferry firm resists law |work=[[The Korea Herald]] |date=14 May 2014 |accessdate=30 May 2014}} Yoo failed to appear at a court hearing on 20 May.{{cite news |last=Hong |first=Gil-dong |url=http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20140520001596 |title=Sewol owner may have fled church compound |work=The Korea Herald |date=20 May 2014 |accessdate=30 May 2014}} On 22 May the [[Incheon]] District Court issued an arrest warrant and Korean authorities offered a {{SK won|50|link=yes}} million ({{US$|48,800}}) reward for information leading to the arrest of Yoo. On 25 May the reward was raised tenfold to {{SK won|500|link=no}} million ({{US$|488,000}}).{{cite news|url=https://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/nation/2014/05/116_157846.html|title=Cat-and-mouse game continues for Yoo clan|last=Lee|first=Hyo-sik|date=24 May 2012|work=[[The Korea Times]]|accessdate=25 May 2014}}{{cite news|url=http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20140525000430|title=Reward for Yoo raised 10-fold|last=Lee|first=Hyo-sik|date=25 May 2014|work=[[The Korea Times]]|accessdate=25 May 2014}} Prosecutors warned on 24 May that anyone who helps Yoo in hiding faces up to three years in prison.{{cite news|last=Park |first=Eun-jee |url=http://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/article/article.aspx?aid=2989634 |title=Prosecutors warn anyone who helps Yoo escape |work=[[Korea JoongAng Daily]] |date=24 May 2014 |accessdate=27 May 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140528005740/http://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/article/article.aspx?aid=2989634 |archivedate=28 May 2014 |df= }} Four members of Yoo's religious group were arrested 25 May for assisting Yoo to escape detection by the police.{{cite news|url=http://www.arirang.co.kr/News/News_View.asp?nseq=162937 |title=Fugitive Sewol-ho ferry owner spotted in southern Korea |publisher=[[Arirang (TV network)|Arirang News]] |date=26 May 2012 |accessdate=27 May 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140601040628/http://www.arirang.co.kr/News/News_View.asp?nseq=162937 |archivedate= 1 June 2014 |df= }} On 26 May Yoo's religious group, in an apparent move to confuse investigators, said that Yoo might have returned early in the morning to Geumsuwon, the church commune in Anseong, [[Gyeonggi Province]]. Geumsuwon is known as the main residence of Yoo.{{cite news |url=http://engsales.yonhapnews.co.kr/YNA/ContentsSales/EngSales/YISW_PopupMpicPreview.aspx?CID=MYH20140502011100345 |title=TV Actress Jeon Yang-ja, Close Aide to Yoo Byung-eon: "I Will Obey Prosecutor's Summons" |agency=[[Yonhap]] |date=22 May 2014 |accessdate=27 May 2014}} A spokesperson for the sect later announced that Yoo had not returned, further saying, "We hope Yoo doesn't get arrested. A 100,000 followers will protect Yoo. Even if the entire congregation of 100,000 believers is arrested, we won't hand him over."{{cite news |last=Kim |first=Da-ye |url=https://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/nation/2014/05/116_157915.html |title=Search for Yoo continues after raids |work=The Korea Times |date=26 May 2014 |accessdate=27 May 2014}}{{cite news|first=Kim-bong |last=Moon |url=http://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/article/article.aspx?aid=2989725 |title=Sect announces it will not let Yoo be arrested |work=[[Korea JoongAng Daily]] |date=27 May 2014 |accessdate=27 May 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140527215730/http://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/article/article.aspx?aid=2989725 |archivedate=27 May 2014 |df= }} Lee Jae-ok, another member of Yoo's religious group, chairman of Yoo's Hemato-Centric Life Foundation, and one of Yoo's close aides, was arrested on 26 May on charges of planning Yoo's life as a fugitive and helping him evade detection for weeks.{{cite news|url=http://english.yonhapnews.co.kr/national/2014/05/27/49/0302000000AEN20140527007300315F.html |title=Manhunt for fugitive ferry owner closing in: prosecution |agency=[[Yonhap]] |date=27 May 2014 |accessdate=27 May 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140527215209/http://english.yonhapnews.co.kr/national/2014/05/27/49/0302000000AEN20140527007300315F.html |archivedate=27 May 2014 |df= }} President [[Park Geun-hye]] during a [[Cabinet of South Korea|Cabinet meeting]] on 27 May ordered a quick arrest of the fugitive Yoo saying he and his family "is ridiculing the law and causing indignation among the people."{{cite news |url=http://english.yonhapnews.co.kr/national/2014/05/27/68/0301000000AEN20140527003651315F.html |title=(LEAD) Park orders quick arrest of fugitive ferry owner |agency=[[Yonhap]] |date=27 May 2013 |accessdate=27 May 2014}} Beginning 27 May, police doubled the number of officers deployed for the search for Yoo from 24,000 to almost 50,000.{{cite news |last=Kim |first=Da-ye |url=https://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/nation/2014/06/116_158279.html |title=50,000 police officers mobilized to search for Yoo |work=[[The Korea Times]] |date=1 June 2014 |accessdate=9 June 2014}} ==== Yoo Som-na ==== Yoo's eldest daughter, Yoo Som-na ({{Lang|ko|유섬나}}; born 1966), was summoned for questioning multiple times by the Prosecution, but evaded the Office's investigation.{{cite news |author= |url=http://french.peopledaily.com.cn/VieSociale/8626515.html |title=Naufrage du Sewol: le propriétaire sommé de se présenter au bureau du procureur |trans-title=Sinking of Sewol: the owner ordered to report to the prosecutor's office |work=[[People's Daily]] |language=French |date=14 May 2014 |accessdate=27 May 2014}}{{cite news |url=http://www.arirang.co.kr/News/News_View.asp?nseq=161887 |title=Investigation into ferry accident continues |publisher=[[Arirang (TV network)|Arirang News]] |date=4 May 2014 |accessdate=27 May 2014}} She heads the interior design and consulting firm Moreal Design with offices on New York's [[Park Avenue]] and in Seoul,{{cite web|url=http://www.morealdesign.com/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=27 May 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140528005307/http://www.morealdesign.com/ |archivedate=28 May 2014 }} Moreal Design which has done design work for many of Semo's affiliates, [[Debauve & Gallais]], Hemato-Centric Life Institute, and NaeClear, and has sponsored Yoo's photographic exhibitions.{{cite web |url=http://www.pdnonline.com/photoserve/Ahae-Exhibition-Pro-2466.shtml |title=Ahae Exhibition Produced by Duggal at Grand Central Terminal |publisher=Pdnonline.com |accessdate=27 May 2014}} On 9 May 2014, police raided the firm's office in southern Seoul on suspicion it had been involved in forming the family's [[slush fund]]s and managing them in overseas accounts.{{cite news |url=http://english.cntv.cn/2014/05/13/ARTI1399982500112717.shtml |title=S.Korean prosecutors to summon sunken ferry's suspected owner |publisher=[[China Central Television]] |date=13 May 2014 |accessdate=27 May 2014}}{{cite news |last=Hong |first=Gil-dong |url=http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20140509001257 |title=Sewol probe expands as victims' anger boils over |work=[[The Korea Herald]] |date=9 May 2014 |accessdate=27 May 2014}} On 11 May, the authorities issued an arrest warrant for Som-na after she failed to appear for questioning.{{cite news |last=Hong |first=Gil-dong |url=http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20140511000365 |title=Brother, aide of ferry firm owner grilled over corruption |work=[[The Korea Herald]] |date=11 May 2014 |accessdate=27 May 2014}} Som-na has been staying in France since February 2013 on a [[Visa policy of the Schengen Area|temporary residence visa]].{{cite news |last1=Park |first1=Eun-jee |last2=Jeong |first2=Hyo-sik |url=http://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/article/Article.aspx?aid=2989596 |title=Hunt begins for Yoos' assets abroad |work=[[Korea JoongAng Daily]] |date=23 May 2014 |accessdate=27 May 2014}} She is accused of embezzling {{SK won|8|link=no}} billion ({{US$|7.8}} million) from her affiliates including Dapanda since 2003 while working as the head of Moreal Design in Seoul.{{cite news |last=Lee |first=Sung-eun |url=http://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/article/article.aspx?aid=2989839 |title=Yoo remains elusive as prosecutors narrow search |work=[[Korea JoongAng Daily]] |date=29 May 2014 |accessdate=29 May 2014}} On 23 May an [[Interpol Red Notice]] was issued, and the [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (South Korea)|Ministry of Foreign Affairs]] ordered Som-na to surrender her passport, while the [[Ministry of Justice (South Korea)|Ministry of Justice]] dispatched local investigators to France to discuss potential [[extradition]]. French law enforcement authorities arrested Som-na under the international arrest warrant on 27 May in her Paris apartment, reportedly worth {{SK won|2.5|link=yes}} billion (US$2.44 million), near [[Champs-Élysées]].{{cite news |last=Hong |first=Gil-dong |url=http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20140527001698 |title=Sunken ferry owner's daughter detained in France |work=The Korea Herald |date=27 May 2014 |accessdate=27 May 2014}}{{cite news |last=Lee |first=Hyo-sik |url=https://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/nation/2014/05/116_158021.html |title=Interpol nabs Yoo's daughter in France |work=The Korea Times |date=24 May 2012 |accessdate=27 May 2014}} The Ministry of Justice said that it will repatriate Som-na following a [[repatriation]] trial in France.{{cite news |url=http://world.kbs.co.kr/english/news/news_Po_detail.htm?lang=e&id=Po&No=102848 |title=Ferry Owner's Daughter Arrested in France |publisher=Korean Broadcasting System |date=27 May 2014 |accessdate=28 May 2014}} She appeared before a judge on 28 May,{{cite news |url=http://m.voanews.com/a/daughter-of-fugitive-south-korea-ferry-owner-arrested-faces-judge/1924087.html |title=Daughter of Fugitive South Korea Ferry Owner Arrested, Faces Judge |publisher=Voice of America |date=28 May 2014 |accessdate=29 May 2014}} who decided against releasing her on bail.{{cite news |url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/2014-05-28/korean-tycoon27s-daughter-detained-in-france-as-part-of-sew/5485238 |title=Fugitive Korean tycoon's daughter detained in Paris as part of Sewol investigation |publisher=Australian Broadcasting Corporation |agency=Agence France-Presse |date=29 May 2014 |accessdate=29 May 2014}} Through her French lawyer, [[Patrick Maisonneuve]], Som-na has said she is innocent of the charges brought against her.{{cite news |url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2014/05/30/2014053000841.html |title=Ferry Owner's Daughter Claims She Is Victim of Witch Hunt |work=[[The Chosun Ilbo]] |date=30 May 2014 |accessdate=9 June 2014}} An appeal court on 11 June rejected Som-na's request for bail citing [[:wikt:flight risk|flight risk]].{{cite news |url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/2014/06/11/uk-southkorea-ferry-france-idUKKBN0EM1U020140611 |title=French court denies bail for daughter of South Korean ferry family's head |agency=Reuters |date=11 June 2014 |accessdate=22 June 2014}} A renewed request to be released pending the extradition decision 17 September was rejected by a Paris judge on 9 July.{{cite news|url=http://asiancorrespondent.com/124617/daughter-of-south-korean-tycoon-stays-jailed-in-france/ |title=Daughter of S. Korean tycoon linked to Sewol ferry stays jailed in France |work=Asian Correspondent |agency=AP |date=10 July 2014 |accessdate=10 July 2014}}{{cite news|last=Lee |first=Hyo-sik |url=http://koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/nation/2014/07/113_160333.html |title=French court to decide on whether to extradite Yoo's daughter in September |work=The Korea Times |date=3 July 2014 |accessdate=15 July 2014}} She is being held at the [[Fresnes Prison]] and is projected to bring her extradition case to the [[French Supreme Court]], or even to judicial authorities of the [[European Union]], which could delay her repatriation up to one year.{{cite news |last=Hong |first=Gil-dong |url=http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20140612001573 |title=Yoo's daughter could appeal to EU |work=[[The Korea Herald]] |date=12 June 2014 |accessdate=22 June 2014}}{{cite news |url=http://www.journaldequebec.com/2014/06/11/naufrage-du-traversier-en-coree-yoo-som-na-reste-en-detention-en-france |title=Naufrage du traversier en Corée: Yoo Som-Na reste en détention en France |trans-title=Sinking of the ferry in Korea: Yoo Som-na remains in custody in France |work=[[Journal de Québec]] |agency=[[Agence France-Presse]] |date=11 June 2014 |accessdate=22 June 2014 |language=French}}{{cite news |url=http://www.20minutes.fr/monde/1398574-naufrage-en-coree-qui-est-yoo-byung-eun-le-proprietaire-du-ferry-traque-par-la-police |title=Naufrage en Corée: Qui est Yoo Byung-Eun, l'homme le plus recherché de Corée du Sud? |trans-title=Shipwreck in Korea: Who is Yoo Byung-Eun, the most wanted man in South Korea? |agency=Agence France-Presse |work=20 Minutes |date=11 June 2014 |accessdate=22 June 2014 |language=French}} On June 2, 2017 the appeal on the extradition order for Yoo Sum-na was rejected by the highest administrative court in France,{{cite news|url=http://english.yonhapnews.co.kr/national/2017/06/02/0301000000AEN20170602001751320.html|title=(LEAD) Woman linked to Sewol operator to be extradited from France|agency=Yonhap News Agency|date=2 June 2017|accessdate=7 June 2017}} and on June 7, 2017 she was arrested by South-Korean officials at the Charles de Gaulle airport, aboard a plane from Korean Airlines bound for Korea.{{cite news|url=http://english.yonhapnews.co.kr/news/2017/06/07/0200000000AEN20170607000551315.html|title=(LEAD) Woman linked to Sewol operator arrested in France|agency=Yonhap News Agency|date=7 June 2017|accessdate=7 Jun 2017}}{{cite news|url=http://english.yonhapnews.co.kr/national/2017/06/07/0302000000AEN20170607000552315.html|title=(2nd LD) Woman linked to Sewol operator arrested in France|agency=Yonhap News Agency|date=7 June 2017|accessdate=7 Jun 2017}} ==== Eight aides ==== During the month of May, numerous persons were questioned and arrested, among them eight people who held top positions at subsidiary companies in Yoo's sphere of influence. * Song Kook-bin ({{Lang|ko|송국빈}}; born {{Circa|1952}}) was summoned for questioning on 30 April. He is CEO of Chonghaejin affiliate Dapanda, a direct-sales company distributing health supplements and cosmetics, and previously served as an CEO of I-One-I Holdings. Yoo's first son, Dae-kyun, is the biggest shareholders of Dapanda. Dapanda holds a 16.2 percent stake in Chonhaeji, the largest shareholder of Chonghaejin Marine, the operator of the ferry ''Sewol''.{{cite news |url=http://english.yonhapnews.co.kr/news/2014/04/30/59/0200000000AEN20140430004300315F.html |title=Ferry owner's close aide grilled over corruption allegations |agency=[[Yonhap]] |date=30 April 2014 |accessdate=29 June 2014}}{{cite news |url=http://www.tbs.seoul.kr/news/bunya.do?method=daum_html&typ_800=P&seq_800=10021751 |title=Probe Reveals Coast Guard Official Worked at Semo |publisher=Tbs.seoul.kr |date=1 May 2014 |accessdate=29 June 2014}}{{cite news |last=Kim |first=Da-ye |url=https://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/nation/2014/05/116_156476.html |title=Semo Group affiliates raided |work=[[The Korea Times]] |date=1 May 2014 |accessdate=29 June 2014}}{{cite news |url=http://english.kbs.co.kr/news/news_view.html?page=5&No=102335&id=Dm |title=페이지를 찾을 수 없습니다 |publisher=English.kbs.co.kr |accessdate=29 June 2014}} Song was subsequently arrested, detained, and on 21 May indicted on charges of embezzling company funds and channeling the money to Yoo and his family, including suspicions of purchasing photographs taken by Yoo for as much as {{SK won|50|link=no}} million (~{{US$|60,000}}) each, dealing significant damages to the company.{{cite news |last=Park |first=Eun-jee |url=http://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/article/article.aspx?aid=2988698 |title=Doomed Sewol carried three times its cargo limit |work=[[Korea JoongAng Daily]] |date=2 May 2014 |accessdate=29 June 2014}}{{cite news |url=http://www.straitstimes.com/the-big-story/south-korea-ferry-sinking/story/south-korea-ferry-disaster-probe-finds-ship-lacked-fea |title=South Korea ferry disaster: Probe finds ship lacked features for holding cargo in place |work=The Straits Times |date=2 May 2014 |accessdate=29 June 2014}} * Lee Jae-young ({{Lang|ko|이재영}}; born {{Circa|1952}}), Ahae Corp CEO, was arrested on 9 May, on charges of breach of trust and facilitating financial irregularities by buying millions of dollars worth of Yoo's photos at prices far higher than market values, thus funding his photography career.{{cite news |last=Park |first=Eun-jee |url=http://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/article/Article.aspx?aid=2988848 |title=Seoul to ask FBI for help in tracking Yoo family |work=[[Korea JoongAng Daily]] |date=8 May 2014 |accessdate=29 June 2014}}{{cite news | url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/05/10/world/asia/south-koreas-leader-and-media-face-scrutiny-over-ferry-disaster.html | title=South Korea’s Leader and Media Face Scrutiny Over Ferry Disaster | work=The New York Times | date=10 May 2014 | accessdate=2 July 2014}} * Lee Gang-se ({{Lang|ko|이강세}}; born {{Circa|1941}}), former Ahae Corp CEO, was questioned in early May over suspicions of aiding Yoo in the establishment of slush funds. Lee admitted that his former company Ahae Corp had paid bogus consultation fees to a shell company operated by Yoo, but said these actions were company custom and had taken place before he became CEO. Lee allegedly received orders to invest Ahae Corp money in the firm Ahae Press France, a company established to publish Yoo's photographs.{{cite news |last=Hong |first=Gil-dong |url=http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20140501000944 |title=Probe into ferry Sewol finds cargo mishandled |work=The Korea Herald |date=1 May 2014 |accessdate=29 June 2014}} Lee was arrested on 23 May and charged for extracting more than {{SK won|1|link=no}} billion (~{{US$|1}} million) from Ahae Corp through an illegal lending scheme.{{cite news |url=http://english.yonhapnews.co.kr/news/2014/05/13/42/0200000000AEN20140513003454315F.html |title=(3rd LD) Prosecutors to question sunken ferry's suspected owner |agency=[[Yonhap]] |date=13 May 2014 |accessdate=29 June 2014}}{{cite news |last=Park |first=Eun-jee |url=http://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/article/Article.aspx?aid=2990734 |title=Trial begins for executives who ran Yoo's empire |work=[[Korea JoongAng Daily]] |date=17 June 2014 |accessdate=29 June 2014}} * Park Seung-il ({{Lang|ko|박승일}}; born {{Circa|1959}}), auditor of I-One-I Holdings and Yoo's close aid was indicted on 23 May on charges of embezzling {{SK won|12.6|link=no}} billion (~{{US$|12.4}} million) in company money.{{cite news |url=http://english.yonhapnews.co.kr/news/2014/05/23/71/0200000000AEN20140523006700315F.html |title=Prosecution receives tip-offs regarding fugitive Sewol owner |agency=[[Yonhap]] |date=23 May 2014 |accessdate=29 June 2014}} * Byeon Ki-choon ({{Lang|ko|변기춘}}; born 1972), CEO of both Semo's shipbuilding unit Chonhaiji and of I-One-I Holdings, and Go Chang-hwan ({{Lang|ko|고창환}}; born {{Circa|1942}}), the CEO of Semo, were in early May suspected of causing tens of billions of won (tens of millions of dollars) in losses to their companies by paying large sums of company funds to purchase photographs by Yoo at excessively high prices and for consulting services from a paper company owned by Yoo's family.{{cite news |url=http://english.yonhapnews.co.kr/topic/2014/05/07/44/1302000000AEN20140507008851315F.html |title=Prosecutors seek arrest warrants for ferry owner's aides |agency=[[Yonhap]] |date=7 May 2014 |accessdate=29 June 2014}} They were on 28 May indicted on charges of inflicting a total of {{SK won|30.1|link=no}} billion (~{{US$|29.7}} million) worth of losses on their firms to help Yoo's family create slush funds.{{cite news |url=http://english.yonhapnews.co.kr/national/2014/05/28/22/0302000000AEN20140528009452315F.html |title=(3rd LD) Prosecution moves to seize Sewol owner family's assets |agency=[[Yonhap]] |date=28 May 2014 |accessdate=29 June 2014}} * Kim Dong-hwan ({{Lang|ko|김동환}}; born {{Circa|1964}}), auditor of Dapanda and senior executive at I-One-I Holdings, was arrested in mid May, and indicted on embezzlement charges on 29 May.{{cite news |url=http://news1.kr/articles/1699565 |title='유병언 측근' 김동환 다판다 감사, 구속기소 |publisher=News1.kr |date=29 May 2014 |accessdate=29 June 2014}} * Oh Kyung-seok ({{Lang|ko|오경석}}; born {{Circa|1961}}), CEO of Hemato-Centric Life Institute and in charge of selling Yoo's photography works, was indicted on embezzlement charges on 31 May.{{cite news |url=http://www.yonhapnews.co.kr/society/2014/05/31/0701000000AKR20140531055500004.HTML |title=檢, 유병언 사진 고가강매 주도 측근 구속기소 | 연합뉴스 |publisher=Yonhapnews.co.kr |agency=[[Yonhap]] |date=31 May 2014 |accessdate=29 June 2014}} The criminal trial of the eight defendants started at Incheon District Court on 16 June, the eight being accused of embezzlement, breach-of-duty and other instances of corruption, with prosecutors alleging that the defendants inflicted between {{SK won|3|link=no}} billion (~{{US$|2.94}} million) and {{SK won|21|link=no}} billion (~{{US$|20.58}} million) worth of losses on their firms to help Yoo's family create slush funds. Three of the defendants denied their charges, the others admitted to irregular intragroup trading, saying that they acted on the orders of Yoo's eldest son, Dae-kyun, and Yoo's close aide Kim Phil-bae, who both reportedly have fled to the United States. Next court meeting is on 9 July.{{cite news |url=http://english.yonhapnews.co.kr/national/2014/06/16/2/0302000000AEN20140616005400315F.html |title=Sewol owner's close aides deny charges as trial opens |agency=[[Yonhap]] |date=16 June 2014 |accessdate=29 June 2014}}{{cite news |url=http://tbsefm.seoul.kr/eNews/news.do?method=efmNewsInfo&idx_800=2031974 |title=Yoo Byung-eun's Aides Deny Charges Against Them During First Trial Today |publisher=Tbsefm.seoul.kr |date=16 June 2014 |accessdate=29 June 2014}}{{cite news |last=Hong |first=Gil-dong |url=http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20140616001073 |title=Ferry firm unit chiefs admit payments to Yoo |work=The Korea Herald |date=16 June 2014 |accessdate=29 June 2014}}{{cite news |last=Park |first=Eun-jee |url=http://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/article/article.aspx?aid=2990764 |title=One month on, Yoo Byung-eun remains elusive |work=[[Korea JoongAng Daily]] |date=18 June 2014 |accessdate=29 June 2014}} ==== Kwon Oh-kyun ==== Yoo's brother-in-law, Kwon Oh-kyun ({{Lang|ko|권오균}}; born {{Circa|1950}}), the younger brother to Yoo's wife, Kwon Yun-ja, was arrested at his home in southern Seoul on charges of [[Criminal negligence|negligence]] on 6 June. Kwon, a key leader of the Salvation Sect, is CEO of the construction firm Trigon Korea, a core affiliate of Chonghaejin Marine, and suspected of embezzling company funds to illicitly transfer to Yoo and Yoo's children.{{cite news |last=Hong |first=Gil-dong |url=http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20140604000971 |title=Yoo's in-law arrested for embezzlement |work=The Korea Herald |date=4 June 2014 |accessdate=25 June 2014}}{{cite news |url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2014/06/05/2014060501337.html |title=Ferry Owner's Brother-in-Law Arrested |work=The Chosun Ilbo |date=5 June 2014 |accessdate=24 June 2014}} On 8 June, a court warrant was issued to [[Detention (imprisonment)|detain]] Kwon, inhibiting he fled the country or destroyed evidence.{{cite news |last=Lee |first=Hyo-sik |url=https://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/nation/2014/06/116_158738.html |title=Yoo proves sly media user |work=The Korea Times |date=8 June 2014 |accessdate=24 June 2014}}{{cite news |last=Hong |first=Gil-dong |url=http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20140608000492 |title=Prosecutors set to summon Yoo's wife |work=The Korea Herald |date=8 June 2014 |accessdate=24 June 2014}}{{cite news |last=Hong |first=Gil-dong |url=http://nwww.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20140615000307 |title=Prosecution speeds up probe into Yoo's relatives, aides |work=The Korea Herald |date=15 June 2014 |accessdate=25 June 2014}} Kwon became the first relative of Yoo to be [[Indictment|indicted]] on 24 June. He is accused of funneling funds of nearly {{SK won|29|link=no}} billion (~{{US$|28,4}} million) into his business after taking out loans with assets of the Evangelical Baptist Church as collateral in 2010, according to prosecutors.{{cite news |url=http://english.yonhapnews.co.kr/topic/2014/06/24/5/1302000000AEN20140624008500315F.html |title=Fugitive Sewol owner's brother-in-law to stand trial |agency=Yonhap |date=24 June 2014 |accessdate=25 June 2014}} ==== Yoo Byung-il ==== Yoo's older brother, Yoo Byung-il ({{Lang|ko|유병일}}; born {{Circa|1939}}), was the first member of Yoo's family who, on 11 May, appeared for questioning. Byung-il was the managing director of the religious facility called Geumsuwon. Prosecutors said they believed that Byung-il had received consultation fees of {{SK won|2.5|link=no}} million (~{{US$|2,400}}) from Chonghaejin Marine each month, and that they had testimonies that he had illegally intervened in the company's management.{{cite news |last=Kim |first=Bong-moon |url=http://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/article/article.aspx?aid=2988997 |title=Former politician questioned in case against Yoo |work=[[Korea JoongAng Daily]] |date=12 May 2014 |accessdate=25 June 2014}} Byung-il was arrested one month later on 13 June, near Geumsuwon.{{cite news |last=McCoy |first=Terrence |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/morning-mix/wp/2014/06/13/the-incredible-south-korean-hunt-for-a-billionaire-cult-leader-who-owned-the-ferry |title=The incredible South Korean hunt for the billionaire church leader who owned that ferry |work=[[The Washington Post]] |date=13 June 2014 |accessdate=25 June 2014}}{{cite news |first=Ju-min |last=Park |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2014/06/13/us-southkorea-ferry-idUSKBN0EO0AH20140613 |title=South Korea sect talks of deer and fireflies startled by police raid |agency=Reuters |date=12 June 2014 |accessdate=25 June 2014}}{{cite news |last=Kim |first=Bong-moon |url=http://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/article/article.aspx?aid=2990604 |title=Sewol probe arrests Yoo's 75-year-old brother |work=Korea JoongAng Daily |date=14 June 2014 |accessdate=25 June 2014}} The prosecution team requested and was granted a pretrial detention warrant for Byung-il on 16 June.{{cite news |last=Kim |first=Da-ye |url=http://koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/nation/2014/06/113_159207.html |title='Yoo's second son masterminded embezzlement scheme' |work=The Korea Times |date=16 June 2014 |accessdate=25 June 2014}}{{cite news |last=Noh |first=Jin-ho |url=http://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/article/Article.aspx?aid=2990657 |title=Detention warrant requested for Yoo's brother |work=Korea JoongAng Daily |date=16 June 2014 |accessdate=25 June 2014}} On 2 July Byung-il was indicted on embezzlement charges suspected of having received a combined {{SK won|13|link=no}} million (~{{US$|129,000}}) from Chonghaejin Marine as consulting fees between June 2010 and April 2014.{{cite news |url=http://english.yonhapnews.co.kr/national/2014/07/02/32/0302000000AEN20140702006400315F.html |title=Fugitive ferry owner's brother, close aides to stand trial |work=Yonhap |date=2 July 2014 |accessdate=2 July 2014}} ==== Shin Myung-hee ==== Shin Myung-hee ({{Lang|ko|신명희}}; born {{Circa|1950}}), a member of the Evangelical Baptist Church called "Mother Shin" by devotees of the sect, had been wanted by law enforcement authorities under suspicion of masterminding Yoo's escape, and on 13 June turned herself in to authorities in [[Suwon]], [[Gyeonggi]]. Shin was detained and in July indicted on charges of playing a major role in helping Yoo evade capture.{{cite news | url=http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20140611001533 | title=Sewol owner’s retreat raided | work=The Korea Herald | date=11 June 2014 | accessdate=2 July 2014}}{{cite news | url=https://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/nation/2014/06/116_159097.html | title=Brother of fugitive Yoo caught | work=The Korea Times | date=13 June 2014 | accessdate=2 July 2014}} ==== Oh Gabriel ==== An unnamed person acting for Yoo contacted the Embassy of France in Seoul in late May and asked about the possibility of Yoo seeking political asylum.{{cite news |last=Lee |first=Hyo-sik |url=https://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/nation/2014/06/116_158530.html |title=Ex-diplomat helped Yoo seek asylum |work=[[The Korea Times]] |date=4 June 2014 |accessdate=4 June 2014}} The embassy declined the request due to Yoo's status as a criminal suspect.{{cite news |agency=Reuters |url=https://news.yahoo.com/south-korean-73-linked-ferry-disaster-fails-asylum-074008225.html |title=South Korean, 73, linked to ferry disaster fails in asylum bid |work=Yahoo News |publisher=Yahoo! News |date=3 June 2014 |accessdate=3 June 2014}}{{cite news |url=http://english.yonhapnews.co.kr/national/2014/06/03/33/0302000000AEN20140603004151315F.html |title=(LEAD) Fugitive Sewol owner tries to seek asylum: prosecution |agency=[[Yonhap]] |date=3 June 2014 |accessdate=3 June 2014}}{{cite news |last=Kim |first=Da-ye |url=https://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/nation/2014/06/116_158408.html |title=Yoo denied political asylum |work=[[The Korea Times]] |date=3 June 2014 |accessdate=3 June 2014}}{{cite news|url=https://au.news.yahoo.com/thewest/world/a/24107196/s-korea-ferry-owner-seeks-asylum-report/ |title=S. Korea ferry owner seeks asylum: report |work=The West Australian |publisher=Yahoo! News |agency=Agence France-Presse |date=3 June 2014 |accessdate=3 June 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140607012725/https://au.news.yahoo.com/thewest/world/a/24107196/s-korea-ferry-owner-seeks-asylum-report/ |archivedate= 7 June 2014 |df= }} Local media outlets said Yoo's middleman also made asylum enquiries at the embassies of the Philippines, the Czech Republic, and Canada.{{cite news |last=Park |first=Eun-jee |url=http://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/article/article.aspx?aid=2990163 |title=Yoo tried using clout in France |work=[[Korea JoongAng Daily]] |date=5 June 2014 |accessdate=4 June 2014}}{{cite news |last=Kim |first=Da-ye |url=https://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/nation/2014/06/116_158642.html |title=Yoo contacted 4 embassies for asylum |work=The Korea Times |date=6 June 2014 |accessdate=7 June 2014}} Yoo's eldest brother-in-law, Oh Gabriel ({{Lang|ko|오갑렬}}; born {{Circa|1955}}), married to Yoo's younger sister, Yoo Gyeong-hee ({{Lang|ko|유경희}}; born {{Circa|1958}}), was arrested with his wife on 19 June, allegedly for aiding Yoo's escape.{{cite news |last1=Noh |first1=Jin-ho |last2=Kim |first2=Bong-moon |url=http://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/article/article.aspx?aid=2990950 |title=Prosecutors, police shift their search for elder Yoo |work=[[Korea JoongAng Daily]] |date=21 June 2013 |accessdate=22 June 2014}} The arrest came following testimony provided by two key adherents of the Evangelical Baptist Church that were arrested earlier in June, saying Oh drove Yoo out of the religious group's commune, Geumsuwon, on 23 April after police surrounded the compound.{{cite news |last=Park |first=Eun-jee |url=http://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/article/Article.aspx?aid=2991002 |title=Yoo's wife questioned after her arrest |work=[[Korea JoongAng Daily]] |date=23 June 2014 |accessdate=22 June 2014}} Oh, who served as the Korean ambassador to the [[Czech Republic]] from January 2010 through June 2013, reportedly played a significant role in garnering support for Yoo's photo exhibitions in France. Oh is currently under review by the [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (South Korea)|Ministry of Foreign Affairs]]'s disciplinary committee for allegations that he abused his authority to help Yoo hold a photo exhibition in France and other European countries. The Prosecution suspect that Oh contacted the French Embassy on behalf of Yoo.{{cite news |last=Hong |first=Gil-dong |url=http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20140603001661 |title=Arrest warrants issued for two ship inspectors |work=[[The Korea Herald]] |date=3 June 2014 |accessdate=22 June 2014}} When questioned, Oh testified that Yoo's family and followers funded and gave him information about the authorities' movements.{{cite news |last1=Kim |first1=Da-ye |last2=Chung |first2=Hyun-chae |url=https://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/nation/2014/06/116_159505.html |title=Yoo's brother-in-law in custody |work=[[The Korea Times]] |date=20 June 2014 |accessdate=22 June 2014}} Oh and his wife were released on 26 June reportedly with the expressed willingness to actively cooperate with the investigation and mediate the surrender of Yoo,{{cite news |last=Hong |first=Gil-dong |url=http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20140626001267 |title=Prosecution pressures Yoo to turn himself in |work=The Korea Herald |date=26 June 2014 |accessdate=27 June 2014}} and because under Korean criminal law family members to a fugitive cannot be punished for hiding or aiding the suspect.{{cite news |url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2014/06/23/2014062302608.html |title=Ferry Owner's Brother Arrested |work=[[The Chosun Ilbo]] |date=23 June 2014 |accessdate=29 June 2014}}{{cite web |url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2014/06/27/2014062702922.html |title=Why Are Ferry Disaster Suspects Held on Different Charges? |work=[[The Chosun Ilbo]] |date=27 June 2014 |accessdate=29 June 2014}} ==== Kwon Yun-ja ==== Yoo's wife, Kwon Yun-ja ({{Lang|ko|권윤자}}; born {{Circa|1942}}), was put on the nation's most wanted list in June. She has been the CEO of a door-to-door sales company, Dalgubeol ({{Lang|ko|달구벌}}), in the southern city of [[Daegu]].{{cite news |last=Hong |first=Gil-dong |url=http://nwww.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20140619001043 |title=Sunken ferry owner's wife placed on wanted list |work=[[The Korea Herald]] |date=19 June 2014 |accessdate=22 June 2014}}{{cite news |url=http://24-7kpop.com/fugitive-sewol-ferry-owners-wife-put-on-wanted-list/ |title=Fugitive Sewol Ferry Owner's Wife Put on Wanted List |publisher=24-7kpop.com |date=19 June 2014 |accessdate=22 June 2014}} Kwon was detained in an apartment in [[Bundang]], [[Gyeonggi Province]] on 21 June and taken in for questioning on charges of embezzling funds from the [[Evangelical Baptist Church of Korea|Evangelical Baptist Church]] and her company, reportedly amounting to more than {{SK won|1|link=no}} billion ({{US$|979,850}}) that had been handed over to her husband and her son to expand their business.{{cite news |url=http://www.globalpost.com/dispatch/news/yonhap-news-agency/140621/fugitive-ferry-owners-wife-under-arrest-alleged-embezzleme-0 |title=Fugitive ferry owner's wife under arrest for alleged embezzlement |work=[[GlobalPost]] |agency=[[Yonhap]] |date=21 June 2014 |accessdate=22 June 2014}}{{cite news |last=Hong |first=Gil-dong |url=http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20140621000061 |title=Fugitive ferry owner's wife arrested |work=[[The Korea Herald]] |date=21 June 2014 |accessdate=22 June 2014}}{{cite news |url=http://www.gulf-times.com/korea/247/details/397306/s-korea-ferry-fugitive%E2%80%99s-wife-is-arrested |title=S Korea ferry fugitive's wife is arrested |work=[[Gulf Times]] |agency=[[Agence France-Presse]] |date=22 June 2014 |accessdate=22 June 2014}}{{cite news |first=Ju-min |last=Park |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/asia/south-korea-sewol-ferry-disaster-wife-of-most-wanted-businessman-arrested-9554227.html |title=South Korea Sewol ferry disaster: wife of 'most wanted' businessman arrested |work=[[The Independent]] |agency=[[Reuters]] |date=22 June 2014 |accessdate=22 June 2014}} In order to keep her in custody, the prosecution asked on 23 June the Incheon District Court to issue an arrest warrant,{{cite news |last=Hong |first=Gil-dong |url=http://nwww.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20140622000221 |title=Warrant sought for Sewol owner's wife |work=[[The Korea Herald]] |date=22 June 2014 |accessdate=22 June 2014}}{{cite news |last=Kim |first=Da-ye |url=https://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/nation/2014/06/116_159642.html |title=Arrest warrant sought for Yoo's wife |work=[[The Korea Times]] |date=24 June 2014 |accessdate=24 June 2014}} which was granted on 24 June. On 14 July prosecutors filed embezzlement charges against Kwon.{{cite news|url=http://news.ninemsn.com.au/world/2014/07/14/19/47/fugitive-korean-ferry-owner-s-wife-charged |title=Fugitive Korean ferry owner's wife charged |agency=AFP |publisher=News.ninemsn.com.au |date=14 July 2014 |accessdate=15 July 2014}} ==== Yoo Byung-ho ==== Yoo's younger brother, Yoo Byung-ho ({{Lang|ko|유병호}}; born {{Circa|1953}}), father-in-law of singer [[Park Jin-young]], was arrested at his residence in Daegu on 22 June.{{cite news |last=Kim |first=Se-jeong |url=http://koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/nation/2014/06/113_159601.html |title=Yoo's brother apprehended |work=The Korea Times |date=24 May 2012 |accessdate=25 June 2014}}{{cite news |last=Hong |first=Gil-dong |url=http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20140622000424 |title=Police detain fugitive ferry owner's brother |work=The Korea Herald |date=22 June 2014 |accessdate=25 June 2014}} The Court issued a custody warrant on 24 June. Byung-ho is suspected of embezzlement, totaling at least {{SK won|1|link=no}} billion (~{{US$|1}} million), from Chonghaejin Marine's sister firms, and to have borrowed {{SK won|3|link=no}} billion (~{{US$|2.8}} million) from one of the family affiliates, and allegedly made members of the religious group pay back {{SK won|1.5|link=no}} billion (~{{US$|1.4}} million) on his behalf while the affiliate suffered losses of {{SK won|1.5|link=no}} billion (~{{US$|1.4}} million).{{cite news |last=Hong |first=Gil-dong |url=http://nwww.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20140624001294 |title=Ferry owner's in-law indicted for embezzlement |work=The Korea Herald |date=24 June 2014 |accessdate=25 June 2014}}{{cite news |url=http://english.yonhapnews.co.kr/national/2014/06/24/5/0302000000AEN20140624008551315F.html |title=(LEAD) Fugitive Sewol owner's brother-in-law to stand trial |agency=[[Yonhap]] |date=24 June 2014 |accessdate=25 June 2014}}{{cite news |last=Hong |first=Gil-dong |url=http://nwww.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20140623001179 |title=JYP Entertainment probed over Sewol |work=The Korea Herald |date=23 June 2014 |accessdate=25 June 2014}}{{cite news |url=http://english.yonhapnews.co.kr/national/2014/06/25/39/0302000000AEN20140625010300315F.html |title=Fugitive ferry owner's brother detained for alleged embezzlement |agency=[[Yonhap]] |date=25 June 2014 |accessdate=26 June 2014}} ==== Lee Seok-hwan ==== On 25 June Lee Seok-hwan ({{Lang|ko|이석환}}; born {{Circa|1949}}), considered Yoo's "right-hand man," was arrested in a parking lot in [[Suwon]], south of Seoul, after avoiding a manhunt for weeks. An influential member of the Evangelical Baptist Church, Lee is suspected of helping Yoo avoid arrest. A court-issued warrant on Lee was sought on 27 June.{{cite news |url=http://english.yonhapnews.co.kr/national/2014/06/25/39/0302000000AEN20140625010300315F.html |title=Fugitive ferry owner's brother detained for alleged embezzlement |agency=[[Yonhap]] |date=25 June 2014 |accessdate=27 June 2014}}{{cite news |last=Kim |first=Se-jeong |url=https://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/nation/2014/06/116_159881.html |title=Yoo believed to be using Viber to evade investigators |work=The Korea Times |date=26 June 2014 |accessdate=27 June 2014}}{{cite news |url=http://english.yonhapnews.co.kr/national/2014/06/27/9/0302000000AEN20140627009300315F.html |title=Arrest warrant sought for fugitive ferry owner's close aide |agency=Yonhap |date=27 June 2014 |accessdate=27 June 2014}} ==== Ongoing investigation ==== In mid June 2014, Chonhaiji Co. Ltd., a ship block maker controlled by Yoo's sons, and the major shareholder of Chonghaejin Marine Company with 39.4%, lodged its application for [[receivership]] at the [[Changwon]] District Court. Chonhaiji had {{SK won|34.8|link=no}} billion (~{{US$|34.19}} million) in outstanding debt to main creditor [[Korea Development Bank]].{{cite news |url=http://www.tradewindsnews.com/casualties/339903/Korean-yard-files | title=Korean yard files | work=TradeWinds | date=26 June 2014 | accessdate=2 July 2014}}{{cite news |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2014/06/23/southkorea-ferry-bankruptcy-idUSL4N0P41QO20140623 | title=Major shareholder of S.Korean ferry operator applies for receivership | agency=Reuters | date=23 June 2014 | accessdate=2 July 2014}} On 27 June the [[Government of South Korea]] had calculated the costs in connection with the sinking of the ferry ''Sewol'' to {{SK won|403.1|link=no}} billion (~{{US$|397.8}} million), and lodged a claim to any properties held directly or by proxy by Yoo and Chonghaejin Marine at the [[Law of South Korea#District Courts|Seoul Central District Court]] to cover compensation payments for the victims.{{cite news |url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2014/06/27/2014062702980.html |title=Gov't Lays Claim to Ferry Owner's Assets |work=The Chosun Ilbo |date=27 June 2014 |accessdate=27 June 2014}}{{cite news |url=http://www.arirang.co.kr/News/News_View.asp?nseq=164607 |title=Prosecutors look to seize assets of sunken ferry owner |publisher=Arirang.co.kr |date=27 June 2014 |accessdate=27 June 2014}}{{cite news |url=http://english.yonhapnews.co.kr/national/2014/06/26/56/0301000000AEN20140626011200315F.html | title=Gov't files for asset seizure against sunken ferry owner | agency=Yonhap | date=26 June 2014 | accessdate=2 July 2014}} The Court on 4 July ordered the sequestration of assets owned by Yoo Byung-eun, four officials of Chonghaejin Marine, and eight crew members aboard ''Sewol''.{{cite news |url=http://english.yonhapnews.co.kr/national/2014/07/04/75/0302000000AEN20140704007500315F.html |title=Court orders seizure of assets of those responsible for ferry disaster |agency=[[Yonhap]] |date=4 July 2014 |accessdate=4 July 2014}} Yoo while on the run purchased around {{Convert|60,000|sqm}} of land near a property in [[South Jeolla Province]] where he sought refuge in May, according to prosecutors. He paid {{SK won|250|link=no}} million (~{{US$|247,000}}) and registered it under the names of the married couple, members of his religious group, who run a rest stop and restaurant near Suncheon and are suspected of aiding Yoo's escape from the law. The Incheon District Court on 2 July ordered in its third decision to temporarily seize assets the confiscation of an additional {{SK won|10.2|link=no}} billion (~{{US$|10}} million) worth of assets owned by Yoo and his family, including the newly acquired property as well as 10 stores in [[Gangnam District]], Seoul, valued at {{SK won|8.5|link=no}} billion (~{{US$|8.4}} million), an apartment owned by Yoo's son Hyuk-kee valued at {{SK won|1.5|link=no}} billion (~{{US$|1.48}} million), and cameras confiscated from a restaurant run by his other son Dae-kyun valued at {{SK won|22|link=no}} million (~{{US$|21,700}}).{{cite news |url=http://www.arirang.co.kr/News/News_View.asp?nSeq=162970 |title=Investigators: "Very close to finding Sewol-ho ferry owner" |publisher=[[Arirang (TV network)|Arirang News]] |date=27 May 2014 |accessdate=4 July 2014}}{{cite news | url=http://english.khan.co.kr/khan_art_view.html?artid=201405281818527&code=710100 | title=Eldest Daughter of Yoo Byeong-eon Arrested in Paris: She Will Stand in a Local Trial if She Resists Extradition | work=[[Kyunghyang Shinmun]] | date=28 May 2014 | accessdate=4 July 2014}}{{cite news |url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2014/07/02/2014070201258.html |title=Ferry Owner Buys Land While on the Run |work=[[The Chosun Ilbo]] |date=2 July 2014 |accessdate=4 July 2014}}{{cite news|last=Hong |first=Gil-dong |url=http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20140709001065 |title=Prosecution to seek arrest warrant for ferry owner again |work=The Korea Herald |date=9 July 2014 |accessdate=10 July 2014}} ;Yoo Dae-kyun Yoo's first son, Yoo Dae-kyun, was involved in the day-to-day operations of [[Chonghaejin Marine]].{{cite news |url=http://www.arirang.co.kr/News/News_View.asp?nseq=162632 |title=Authorities still searching for owner of sunken Sewol-ho ferry |publisher=[[Arirang (TV network)|Arirang News]] |date=21 May 2014 |accessdate=9 June 2014}} He was the biggest shareholder of four affiliates of the family businesses including the holding company of the operator of ''Sewol'', I-One-I Holdings. Prosecutors found evidence proving that Dae-kyun received monthly wages from affiliates that he did not own shares of. He is suspected of collecting billions of won in "consulting fees" from the firms and creating a slush fund. Dae-gyun also registered the name "Ohamana" for a sister ferry of the ''Sewol''.{{cite news |last=Kim |first=Da-ye |url=https://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/nation/2014/05/116_157022.html |title=Yoo's children all snub prosecution's summonses |work=[[The Korea Times]] |date=12 May 2014 |accessdate=9 June 2014}} Dae-gyun is wanted for a string of corruption charges and irregularities that are believed to have contributed to the sinking of the ''Sewol''. Dae-kyun bought an airplane ticket to France and was reportedly spotted at [[Incheon International Airport]] on 19 April, but didn't board the plane. He was supposed to appear for questioning at the Incheon District Prosecutors' Office, but failed to show up.{{cite news |url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2014/05/13/2014051300779.html |title=Ferry Owner's Children Go Underground |work=[[The Chosun Ilbo]] |date=13 May 2014 |accessdate=9 June 2014}} Prosecutors obtained an arrest warrant for Dae-kyun on 13 May, but investigators were unable to find him.{{cite news |url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2014/05/15/2014051501308.html |title=Ferry Owner Cult Members Barricade Compound |work=[[The Chosun Ilbo]] |date=15 May 2014 |accessdate=9 June 2014}} He was placed on the most-wanted list amid fears that he would flee the country. The Court approved on 20 May a proposal by the Prosecution and the [[National Tax Service]] to place real estate assets worth {{SK won|20|link=no}} billion (~{{US$|19}} million) under confiscation. Among the properties was land in the [[Seocho District]] and [[Gangnam District]] of southern Seoul and two business offices in [[Gangnam-gu]]. All properties had been registered in the name of Yoo Dae-kyun. On 22 May the Korean authorities labeled Yoo Byung-eun and Yoo Dae-kyun as fugitives,{{cite news |url=http://english.yonhapnews.co.kr/national/2014/05/22/33/0302000000AEN20140522004151315F.html |title=(LEAD) Sewol owner put on wanted list |agency=[[Yonhap]] |date=22 May 2014 |accessdate=9 June 2014}} and initially offered a {{SK won|50|link=no}} million (~{{US$|48,800}}) reward for Yoo and a {{SK won|30|link=no}} million (~{{US$|29,300}}) reward for Dae-kyun for information leading to their arrest. On 25 May the rewards were raised to {{SK won|500|link=no}} million (~{{US$|488,000}}) for the older Yoo and to {{SK won|100|link=no}} million (~{{US$|97,600}}) for the son,{{cite news |url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2014/05/26/2014052600748.html |title=Bounty on Fugitive Ferry Owner's Head Increased |work=[[The Chosun Ilbo]] |date=26 May 2014 |accessdate=9 June 2014}} the largest amount ever offered by an investigative authority as a reward in South Korea.{{cite news |url=http://m.voanews.com/a/daughter-of-fugitive-south-korea-ferry-owner-arrested-faces-judge/1924087.html |title=Daughter of Fugitive South Korea Ferry Owner Arrested, Faces Judge |publisher=[[Voice of America]] |date=28 May 2014 |accessdate=9 June 2014}} ;Yoo Hyuk-kee Yoo's second son, Yoo Hyuk-kee, reportedly was involved in the day-to-day managing of [[Chonghaejin Marine]]. Hyuk-kee, apart from his stake in I-One-I Holdings, owns some 10 percent stake in Ahae Corp., a paint manufacturing company, and a stake in Ahae Press Corp. As CEO of Ahae Press Inc. in New York, Ahae Press France in Paris, and Ahae Press Ltd. UK in London, he has built up his fathers image as a talented photographer, and has curated his exhibitions.{{cite news |url=http://www.francezone.com/xe/hanweeklynews/404832 |script-title=ko:한위클리뉴스 - 프랑스에서 아해의 실체 밝혀낸 베르나르 아쉬케노프기자 |publisher=Francezone.com |date=29 May 2014 |accessdate=20 June 2014 |language=Korean}} Hyuk-kee had been summoned for questioning by 8 May, but ignored the summonses. On 23 May an [[Interpol Red Notice]] was issued. He is suspected of helping his father establish a slush fund through paper companies.{{cite news |url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2014/05/12/2014051200853.html |title=Ferry Owner's Relatives Summoned for Questioning |work=The Chosun Ilbo |date=12 May 2014 |accessdate=20 June 2014}} Hyuk-kee, who is known outside Korea as Keith H. Yoo, is based in the U.S. and, according to sources, either has [[Permanent residence (United States)|permanent residence]] status or holds a [[Citizenship in the United States|U.S. citizenship]]. He left South Korea for the U.S. shortly after the sinking of the ''Sewol'' on 16 April,{{cite news |url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2014/05/27/2014052701467.html |title=Woman Held for Aiding Ferry Owner's Escape |work=The Chosun Ilbo |date=27 May 2014 |accessdate=20 June 2014}} and attempted to make his way to France but didn't get on his booked flight. Hyuk-kee and his wife allegedly own at least three apartments on [[Manhattan]] and near the [[Arc de Triomphe]] in Paris estimated to be worth around {{US$|6.2}} million (~{{SK won|6.3|link=no}} billion) altogether. The prosecutors have asked the [[United States Department of Homeland Security]]'s [[U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement|Investigations Directorate]] to track down real estate and deposits under the names of the siblings or affiliates of the family business.{{cite news |url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2014/05/26/2014052601506.html |title=Extradition of Ferry Owner's Family, Cronies Sought |work=The Chosun Ilbo |date=26 May 2014 |accessdate=20 June 2014}} == Personal life == Yoo was known, due to his reclusiveness, as "the millionaire with no face."{{cite news |last=Kent |first=Emily |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2611954/Reclusive-owner-South-Korean-ferry-dubbed-millionaire-no-face-raided-police-revealed-ran-CULT.html |title=South Korean ferry patriarch Yoo Byung-eun's home raided by police |work=Daily Mail |date=24 April 2014 |accessdate=21 May 2014}} He married Kwon Yun-ja ({{Korean|hangul=권윤자|hanja=|rr=Gwo Nyun-ja}}; born {{Circa|1942}}), the daughter of Kwon Shin-chan, in 1966.{{cite news |url=http://www.mt.co.kr/view/mtview.php?type=1&no=2014050213424320985 |script-title=ko:'구원파'로 맺어진 유병언 인맥...정계에서 연예계까지 |work=Money Today |language=Korean |publisher=Mt.co.kr |date=2 May 2014 |accessdate=27 May 2014}} He had four children with her:{{cite news |last=Hong |first=Gil-dong |url=http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20140523001123 |title=Yoo's children make Interpol's 'red notice' list |work=[[The Korea Herald]] |date=23 May 2014 |accessdate=27 May 2014}}{{cite news |url=http://news.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2014/04/30/2014043000202.html?related_all |script-title=ko:세월호 참사 / 유병언 一家 수사] 유씨 자녀·측근, 귀국時限 넘겨... 검찰 "계좌동결·旅券무효화 검토" - 1등 인터넷뉴스 조선닷컴 |work=[[Chosun Ilbo]] |language=Korean |date=30 April 2014 |accessdate=28 May 2014}} daughter Yoo Som-na ({{Korean|hangul=유섬나|hanja=|rr=Yu Seom-na}}; born 1966), also known as Ennette Yoo,{{cite news |url=http://news.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2014/05/24/2014052400250.html |title=유병언 차남 등 4명 犯罪人 인도 요청 - 1등 인터넷뉴스 조선닷컴 |work=[[Chosun Ilbo]] |date=24 May 2014 |accessdate=27 May 2014}} daughter Yoo Sang-na ({{Korean|hangul=유상나|hanja=|rr=Yu Sang-na}}; born {{Circa|1968}}),{{cite news |url=http://www.munhwa.com/news/view.html?no=2014042501070527031002 |script-title=ko:유씨 자녀들 불법증여 의혹 집중추궁... '7인방'도 줄소환 |work=[[Munhwa Ilbo]] |language=Korean |date=25 April 2014 |accessdate=28 May 2014}}{{cite web |url=http://hdoc.tistory.com/1240 |title=구원파란 오대양사건 / 구원파 연예인 명단 , 아해 유병언 구원파 / 구원파 이단 규정 / 기독교복음침례회 권신찬 목사 연예인 구원파 명단 , 구원파 연예인 양희은 ? |publisher=Hdoc.tistory.com |accessdate=28 May 2014}} son Yoo Dae-kyun ({{Korean|hangul=유대균|hanja=|rr=Yu Dae-gyun}}; born {{circa|1970}}), and second son Yoo Hyuk-kee ({{Korean|hangul=유혁기|hanja=|rr=Yu hyuk-ki}}; born 1972), also known as Keith H. Yoo.{{cite news |last=Lee |first=Hyo-sik |url=https://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/nation/2014/05/116_158021.html |title=Interpol nabs Yoo's daughter in France |work=The Korea Times |date=24 May 2012 |accessdate=29 May 2014}} === Reported death === South Korean authorities initially offered a {{SK won|50|link=yes}} million (~{{US$|48,800}}) reward for information leading to the arrest of Yoo. On 25 May the reward was raised tenfold to {{SK won|500|link=no}} million (~{{US$|488,000}}). South Korean police reported in July 2014 that a body found in June in a field about {{convert|185|mi}} south of Seoul is believed to be Yoo's. The body was wearing a winter sweater and was "seriously decomposed." Preliminary DNA analysis indicates a "fair match". The death was later confirmed.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-28413651|title=S Korea ferry boss Yoo Byung-eun death confirmed|date=22 July 2014|accessdate=22 July 2014|publisher=BBC News}} == Bibliography == *{{cite book |first=Byung-eun |last=Yoo |title=God so Loved I |year=2004 |url=http://god.com/books/god1.pdf |deadurl=yes |location=New York |publisher=Evangelical Media Group |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140327044913/http://god.com/books/god1.pdf |archivedate=27 March 2014}} *{{cite book |first=Byung-eun |last=Yoo |title=God so Loved II |year=2004 |url=http://god.com/books/god2.pdf |deadurl=yes |location=New York |publisher=Evangelical Media Group |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140327040359/http://god.com/books/god2.pdf |archivedate=27 March 2014}} *{{cite book |first=Byung-eun |last=Yoo |title=The Anchor of the Soul |year=2004 |url=http://god.com/books/anchor.pdf |deadurl=yes |location=New York |publisher=Evangelical Media Group |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140327035756/http://god.com/books/anchor.pdf |archivedate=27 March 2014}} *{{cite book |first=B.
